alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 7:13PM MDT until July 26 at 10:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar in... West Central San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 1015 PM MDT. * At 713 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms tracking towards the north producing heavy rain over the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Tecolote Creek drainage area including Cabo Lucero Creek, Canon Mesteno, Ojitos Frios Creek and Tecolote Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mineral Hill, San Geronimo, San Pablo and Ojitos Frios. This includes the following highways... State Road 283 between Mile Markers 6 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
